Action: Test Admin Application Search Interactions
Go to the DOAJ admin applications search at /admin/applications
Expected Test Results:
* All available records are found, and the first page of results is shown
* Results are sorted by date applied, oldest first

Action: Open one of the facets of your choice
Open and Collapse all the facets on the left
Expected Test Results:
* The facet opens and closes as expected
* Each facet contains a maximum of 10 values relevant to that field

Action: Select one of the values for that facet
Expected Test Results:
* All the results for the selected constraints are found, and the first page is shown
* The filter applied is shown in the facets on the left and above the search results

Action: Click the value off in the facet to the left so all values are shown again
Expected Test Results: * The search results are reset.

Action: Go through each sort option in the sort option for one facet
Expected Test Results: * The order that the filters are listed in changes accordingly

Action: In each case, click the "sort by" button to reverse the direction of sort
Expected Test Results: * The order that the filters are listed in changes accordingly

Action: Go through each SORT BY option at the top of the search results, choosing from Relevance, Title, Last updated, Date added  and remembering to change the order from Ascending to Descending
Expected Test Results: * The current search results change with each selection and are then ordered correctly according to the selected sort field and the selected sort direction

Action: Enter a search term in the search box
Expected Test Results:
* All the results for the selected constraints are found, and the first page is shown
* Your search text remains in the search box

Action: Go through each field constraint under the "search all" pull-down.  You may change your search text if no results are found, to demonstrate that each field works correctly
Expected Test Results:
* If there are search results, the first page is displayed
* If there are no search results, suitable "No results to display" text is displayed

Action: Change the number of results on one page using the results per page pulldown
Expected Test Results: * The size of the page of results displays increases appropriately

Action: Scroll to the bottom
Expected Test Results: * The page size displayed at the end of the search results matches.

Action: Click the "Next" button to go to the next page of results
Expected Test Results:
* The next page of results is displayed
* The "First" and "Prev" buttons are activated

Action: Scroll to the bottom of the page. Click Next again.
Expected Test Results: * The page automatically scrolls to the top of the next page

Action: Click "Next" again
Click "Prev"
Expected Test Results: * You are navigated one page forward and then one page back in the results

Action: Click "First"
Expected Test Results: * You are taken to the first page of the results

Action: Click the black X button to clear all filters
Expected Test Results: * The interface returns to the initial state

Action: Test Admin Application Search Display
Go to the DOAJ admin application search at /admin/applications
Open the "Application Status" facet and select "Rejected"
Expected Test Results: * Every result includes the text "View finished application" or "View finished update" at the bottom

Action: Click on "View finished application" for one of the results
Expected Test Results:
* You are taken to the edit form for the application
* The Quick Reject feature is not available

Action: Click "Unlock and Close"
Clear the "Rejected" filter and select "Accepted" from the "Application Status" facet
Expected Test Results: * Every result includes the text "View finished application" or "View finished update" at the bottom

Action: Clear the "Accepted" filter and select any other status except "Rejected" from the "Application Status" facet
Expected Test Results: * Every result includes the text "Review application" or "Review update" on the bottom right

Action: Click on "Review Application"
Expected Test Results:
* You are taken to the edit form for the application in a new tab
* The Quick Reject feature is available

Action: Click "Unlock and Close"
Clear the "Application Status" filter
Open the "Record type" facet and select "new application"
Expected Test Results: * Every result includes the text "Review application" on the bottom right

Action: Clear the "new application" filter and select "update request" from the "Record type" facet
Expected Test Results:
* Every result includes the text "View journal being updated" and "Review update" at the bottom
* The metadata for each record contains the field "Update Request For", and then an alphanumeric ID of a journal

Action: Click on the alphanumeric journal id
Expected Test Results: * You are taken to the admin Journal search interface, and there is one result, which is the current journal for that update request

Action: Click back (as many times as needed) in your browser to return to the application search
Click on "view journal being updated" on the bottom right of one of your search results
Expected Test Results: * You are taken to the Journal Form of the journal being updated

Action: Click "Unlock and Close"
Click on "Review update"
Expected Test Results: * The update request review form is shown

Action: Click "Unlock and Close"
Clear the "Record type" filter
Open the "Journal License" facet and select one of the CC licences
Expected Test Results: * The "Journal Licence" metadata field in each search result has the appropriate CC icon displayed
